items.name: Component_ThreePartImage
items.content:
# =================================================================== # # Script: Component_ThreePartImage # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class Component_ThreePartImage extends gs.Component_Visual ###* * Called if this object instance is restored from a data-bundle. It can be used * re-assign event-handler, anonymous functions, etc. * * @method onDataBundleRestore. * @param Object data - The data-bundle * @param gs.ObjectCodecContext context - The codec-context. ### onDataBundleRestore: (data, context) -> @setupEventHandlers() ###* * A three-part image component displays an object on screen using three * sub-images: start, middle and end. The start and end will be rendered * with fixed size while the middle-part will be stretched in a way like this:
*
* |Start-Part Fixed|<-----------Middle-Part Stretched----------->|End-Part Fixed
*
* A three-part image is automatically added to the graphics-system * and rendered every frame until it gets disposed. It can be horizontal or * vertical. * * @module gs * @class Component_ThreePartImage * @extends gs.Component_Visual * @memberof gs * @constructor ### constructor: (viewport) -> super() ###* * The native three-part image graphic object. * @property threePartImage * @type gs.ThreePartImage ### @threePartImage = new gs.ThreePartImage(viewport ? Graphics.viewport) ###* * The name of the image used to construct the three-part image. * @property image * @type string * @protected ### @image = null ###* * Disposes the three-part image. * * @method dispose ### dispose: -> super @threePartImage.dispose() ###* * Adds event-handlers for mouse/touch events * * @method setupEventHandlers ### setupEventHandlers: -> @threePartImage.onIndexChange = => @object.rIndex = @threePartImage.index ###* * Setup the three-part image component. This method is automatically called by the * system. * @method setup ### setup: -> @setupEventHandlers() ###* * Updates the three-part image properties from the game object properties. * * @method updateProperties ### updateProperties: -> @threePartImage.x = @object.dstRect.x - @object.dstRect.width * (@object.zoom.x - 1.0) * @object.anchor.x @threePartImage.y = @object.dstRect.y - @object.dstRect.height * (@object.zoom.y - 1.0) * @object.anchor.y @threePartImage.width = @object.dstRect.width @threePartImage.height = @object.dstRect.height @threePartImage.firstPartSize = @object.firstPartSize || 16 @threePartImage.middlePartSize = @object.middlePartSize || 1 @threePartImage.lastPartSize = @object.lastPartSize || 16 @threePartImage.visible = @object.visible @threePartImage.ox = -@object.origin.x @threePartImage.oy = -@object.origin.y @threePartImage.z = (@object.zIndex || 0) + (if !@object.parent then 0 else @object.parent.zIndex || 0) @threePartImage.angle = @object.angle || 0 @threePartImage.anchor.x = @object.anchor.x @threePartImage.anchor.y = @object.anchor.y ###* * Updates the padding. * * @method updatePadding ### updatePadding: -> if @object.padding? @threePartImage.x += @object.padding.left @threePartImage.y += @object.padding.top @threePartImage.width -= @object.padding.left+@object.padding.right @threePartImage.height -= @object.padding.top+@object.padding.bottom ###* * Updates the skin-image used to construct the three-part image. * * @method updateImage ### updateImage: -> if @object.image? and @image != @object.image @image = @object.image bitmap = ResourceManager.getBitmap("#{@object.imageFolder||"Graphics/Pictures"}/#{@object.image}") @threePartImage.skin = bitmap ###* * Updates the three-part image. * * @method update ### update: -> super @object.rIndex = @threePartImage.index @updateProperties() @updatePadding() @updateImage() gs.Component_ThreePartImage = Component_ThreePartImage
